content:
Vector3D Struct

Definition

Represents a displacement in 3-D space.

In this Article

[System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter(typeof(System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3DConverter))]
[System.Windows.Markup.ValueSerializer(typeof(System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Converters.Vector3DValueSerializer))]
public struct Vector3D : IFormattable
Inheritance
Object
System.ValueType
Vector3D

Remarks

XAML Attribute Usage

<object property="x,y,z"/>  
-or  
<object property="x y z"/>

XAML Values

x
The X component of this Vector3D structure.

y
The Y component of this Vector3D structure.

z
The Z component of this Vector3D structure.

Constructors

Vector3D(Double,Double,Double)

Initializes a new instance of a Vector3D structure.

public Vector3D (double x, double y, double z);
x
Double

The new Vector3D structure's stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D.X* value.

y
Double

The new Vector3D structure's stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D.Y* value.

z
Double

The new Vector3D structure's stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D.Z* value.

Properties

Length

Gets the length of this Vector3D structure.

public double Length { get; }
Value
Double

The length of this Vector3D structure.

Remarks

The length of a Vector3D is sometimes referred to as the magnitude.

LengthSquared

Gets the square of the length of this Vector3D structure.

public double LengthSquared { get; }
Value
Double

The square of the length of this Vector3D structure.

Remarks

The length of a Vector3D is sometimes referred to as the magnitude.

X

Gets or sets the X component of this Vector3D structure.

public double X { get; set; }
Value
Double

The X component of this Vector3D structure. The default value is 0.

Y

Gets or sets the Y component of this Vector3D structure.

public double Y { get; set; }
Value
Double

The Y component of this Vector3D structure. The default value is 0.

Z

Gets or sets the Z component of this Vector3D structure.

public double Z { get; set; }
Value
Double

The Z component of this Vector3D structure. The default value is 0.

Methods

Add(Vector3D,Point3D)

Translates the specified Point3D structure by the specified Vector3D structure and returns the result as a Point3D structure.

public static System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D Add (System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D vector, System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D point);
vector
Vector3D

The Vector3D structure used to translate the specified Point3D structure.

point
Point3D

The Point3D structure to be translated.

Returns
Point3D

The result of translating point by vector.

Add(Vector3D,Vector3D)

Adds two Vector3D structures and returns the result as a Vector3D structure.

public static System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D Add (System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D vector1, System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D vector2);
vector1
Vector3D

The first Vector3D structure to add.

vector2
Vector3D

The second Vector3D structure to add.

Returns
Vector3D

The sum of vector1 and vector2.

AngleBetween(Vector3D,Vector3D)

Retrieves the angle required to rotate the first specified Vector3D structure into the second specified Vector3D structure.

public static double AngleBetween (System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D vector1, System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D vector2);
vector1
Vector3D

The first Vector3D structure to evaluate.

vector2
Vector3D

The second Vector3D structure to evaluate.

Returns
Double

The angle in degrees needed to rotate vector1 into vector2.

Remarks

Signed angles do not extend into 3-D space, so an angle between 0 and 180 degrees is returned.

CrossProduct(Vector3D,Vector3D)

Calculates the cross product of two Vector3D structures.

public static System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D CrossProduct (System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D vector1, System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D vector2);
vector1
Vector3D

The first Vector3D structure to evaluate.

vector2
Vector3D

The second Vector3D structure to evaluate.

Returns
Vector3D

The cross product of vector1 and vector2.

Divides the specified Vector3D structure by the specified scalar and returns the result as a Vector3D.

public static System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D Divide (System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D vector, double scalar);
vector
Vector3D

The Vector3D structure to be divided.

scalar
Double

The scalar to divide vector by.

Returns
Vector3D

The result of dividing vector by scalar.

DotProduct(Vector3D,Vector3D)

Calculates the dot product of two Vector3D structures.

public static double DotProduct (System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D vector1, System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D vector2);
vector1
Vector3D

The first Vector3D structure to evaluate.

vector2
Vector3D

The second Vector3D structure to evaluate.

Returns
Double

The dot product of vector1 and vector2.

Equals(Object)

Determines whether the specified object is a Vector3D structure and whether the stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D.X*, stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D.Y*, and stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D.Z* properties of the specified Object are equal to the stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D.X*, stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D.Y*, and stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D.Z* properties of this Vector3D structure.

public override bool Equals (object o);
o
Object

The object to compare.

Returns
Boolean

true if o is a Vector3D structure and is identical with this Vector3D structure; false otherwise.

Remarks

If o is not a Vector3D structure, this method returns false.

Vector3D values are described using Double values. Because the value of a Double can lose precision when operated upon, a comparison between two Vector3D values that are logically equal might fail.

Equals(Vector3D)

Compares two Vector3D structures for equality.

public bool Equals (System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D value);
value
Vector3D

The instance of Vector to compare against this instance.

Returns
Boolean

true if instances are equal; otherwise, false.

Remarks

Vector3D values are described using Double values. Because the value of a Double can lose precision when operated upon, a comparison between two Vector3D values that are logically equal might fail.

Equals(Vector3D,Vector3D)

Compares two Vector3D structures for equality.

public static bool Equals (System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D vector1, System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D vector2);
vector1
Vector3D

First Vector3D to compare.

vector2
Vector3D

Second Vector3D to compare.

Returns
Boolean

true if the stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D.X*, stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D.Y*, and stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D.Z* components of vector1 and vector2 are equal; false otherwise.

Remarks

Two Vector3D structures are equal if the values of their X, Y, and Z properties are the same.

Vector3D values are described using Double values. Because the value of a Double can lose precision when operated upon, a comparison between two Vector3D values that are logically equal might fail.

Negate()

Negates a Vector3D structure.

public void Negate ();

Remarks

The vector has the same magnitude as before, but its direction is now opposite.

Normalize()

Normalizes the specified Vector3D structure.

public void Normalize ();

Remarks

A normalized Vector3D maintains its direction but its magnitude becomes 1. The resulting Vector3D is often called a unit vector. A Vector3D is normalized by dividing the Vector3D by its magnitude.

Parse(String)

Converts a String representation of a 3-D vector into the equivalent Vector3D structure.

public static System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D Parse (string source);
source
String

The String representation of the 3-D vector.

Returns
Vector3D

The equivalent Vector3D structure.

Vector3D

The Vector3D structure to negate.

Returns
Vector3D

A Vector3D structure with stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D.X*, stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D.Y*, and stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D.Z* values opposite of the stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D.X*, stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D.Y*, and stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D.Z* values of vector.

Remarks

The returned Vector3D structure has the same magnitude (Length) as vector but its direction is opposite of that of vector.
